entities.label: Case 0278/04 - Pristina Airport FIDS Tender Irregularity
United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo (UNMIK)

edges.label: 1. Initial Procurement Selection
edges.tooltip: Vendor 1 was initially selected for FIDS due to their previous provision.

edges.label: 2. Subsequent Tender Winner
edges.tooltip: Vendor 2 won the tender for FIDS cabling after Vendor 1 was unable to handle it.

edges.label: 3. Allegation of Irregular Involvement
edges.tooltip: Vendor 2 Representative was involved in recommending and justifying procurement decisions.

edges.label: 4. Management Failure Allegation
edges.tooltip: PEAP Official did not fulfill management requirements for handling sensitive airport matters.

edges.label: 5. Applicable Regulation
edges.tooltip: Financial Agreement 1999/2 was the procurement regulation applicable during the investigation.

edges.label: 6. Investigation Conducted By
edges.tooltip: UNMIK conducted the investigation into the FIDS tender irregularity.

Vendor 2: Involvement of Vendor 2 Representative in recommending procurement decisions.
Vendor 2 Representative's involvement provided a competitive advantage in the tender.
PEAP Official: Did not fulfill management requirements for handling sensitive airport matters.
